original: de nas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon las byung ba'i 'od zer rnams kyis @226b de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs bkug la /🔽mdun gyi nam mkha'i phyogs su bzhugs par bsams nas /

translated: Then, light rays come from the seed in the heart of the gnosis being and invoke the assembly of tathāgatas.

translated: Just as the great offering🔽was made to Buddha Vajra of Awakening,

analyzed: zhes bya bas dbang bskur bar gsol ba btab pa'i tshigs su bcad pas dbang bskur bar gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs la /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las byung ba'i spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo ye shes kyi bdud rtsis yongs su gang ba'i rin po che'i bum pa bsnams pa rnams kyis gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang / rol mo dang bkra shis kyi glu rnams sna tshogs pa'i ca co 'don pas bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bsams la /🔽byang chub kyi sems de yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las byung ba'i spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo ye shes kyi bdud rtsis yongs su gang ba'i rin po che'i bum pa bsnams pa rnams kyis gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang / rol mo dang bkra shis kyi glu rnams sna tshogs pa'i ca co 'don pas bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bsams la / byang chub kyi sems de yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: Imagine that goddesses such as Eyes, who emerge from the bodies of the transcendent ones, hold jeweled vases filled with the elixir of timeless awareness and confer empowerment upon you with various exclamations and songs of auspiciousness.🔽🔽The essence of your bodhicitta transforms into the form of a moon mandala.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gi dbu'i steng gi cod pan la bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gi dbu'i steng gi cod pan la bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: Imagine that the goddesses such as Locanā, who emerge from the body of the Tathāgata, and who hold jeweled vases filled with the elixir of pristine awareness, confer the empowerment upon you with the offerings such as the goddess of form, and with various sounds of music and auspicious songs.

original: 'di ni dbang gi 'bras bu chung ngu dang / sgrub pa chen po'i yan lag chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang gi 'bras bu chung ngu dang / sgrub pa chen po'i yan lag chung ngu yin no //
translated: The result of the empowerment is the small, and the small branch of the great practice.🔽The great branch of the great practice is as follows.

original: de nas rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma yang bdag nyid sngar bsnyen pa chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim pas mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / thugs dang gsung dang sku rdo rjer byin gyis brlab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma yang bdag nyid sngar bsnyen pa chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim pas mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa dang / thugs dang gsung dang sku rdo rjer byin gyis brlab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: consecrating the mind, speech, and body as the three vajras, and consecrating the empowerment conferred by all the Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: yan lag bzhi pa bar ma rdzogs par byas nas rigs lnga dang bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa bar ma rdzogs par byas nas rigs lnga dang bsre bar bya'o //
translated: Having completed the medium four branches, one should mix with the five clans.

original: de'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /🔽nu ma yan chad nas mgo bo'i bar du yi ge aom dkar po yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni 'di yin te / nu ma yan chad nas mgo bo'i bar du yi ge aom dkar po yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: The stages of that are as follows:🔽From the breast up to the head, the white letter oṃ transforms into the nature of the subtle particles of Vairochana.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phra rab kyi rang bzhin nu ma'i 'og nas lte ba yan chad du yi ge h'um sngon po yongs su gyur pa las mi bskyod pa'i phra rab kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phra rab kyi rang bzhin nu ma'i 'og nas lte ba yan chad du yi ge h'um sngon po yongs su gyur pa las mi bskyod pa'i phra rab kyi rang bzhin /
translated: From the breast down to the navel, the blue letter hūṃ transforms into the nature of the subtle particles of Akṣhobhya.

original: lte ba'i 'og nas rked pa'i bar du yi ge sv'a sar po yongs su gyur pa las rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phra rab kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: lte ba'i 'og nas rked pa'i bar du yi ge sv'a sar po yongs su gyur pa las rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phra rab kyi rang bzhin /
translated: From below the navel up to the waist, the syllable svā becomes a yellow ratna, the nature of the subtle particles of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: padma nas brla gnyis su yi ge a'a:dmar po yongs su gyur pa las 'od dpag tu med pa'i phra rab kyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: padma nas brla gnyis su yi ge a'a:dmar po yongs su gyur pa las 'od dpag tu med pa'i phra rab kyi rang bzhin /
translated: From the lotus up to the two thighs, the red syllable āḥ becomes a lotus, the nature of the subtle particles of Amitābha.

original: pus mo gnyis nas brtsams te /
analyzed: pus mo gnyis nas brtsams te /
translated: From the two knees

original: rkang mthil gnyis kyi mthar thug par yi ge h'a ljang gu yongs su gyur pa las don yod par grub pa'i rang bzhin @227a * //
analyzed: rkang mthil gnyis kyi mthar thug par yi ge h'a ljang gu yongs su gyur pa las don yod par grub pa'i rang bzhin @227a * //
translated: up to the soles of the feet, the green syllable haṃ becomes a sword, the nature of the subtle particles of Amoghasiddhi.

original: no ; / de ltar rang gi rig ma la rigs lnga dang bsre ba dmigs la /
analyzed: no ; / de ltar rang gi rig ma la rigs lnga dang bsre ba dmigs la /
translated: Thus one should visualize the five families in one’s consort.

original: de nas yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las rang gi rdo rje /
analyzed: de nas yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las rang gi rdo rje /
translated: Then one’s vajra is the transformation of the syllable hūṃ.

original: aom yongs su gyur pa las nor bu /🔽bu gar phat kyis byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: aom yongs su gyur pa las nor bu / bu gar phat kyis byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: The jewel is the transformation of the syllable oṃ.🔽Bless the opening with phaṭ.

original: rang gi rig ma la yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las padma /
analyzed: rang gi rig ma la yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las padma /
translated: One’s consort’s lotus is the transformation of the syllable hūṃ.

original: yi ge a'a: yongs su gyur pa las lte bar bsam mo //
analyzed: yi ge a'a: yongs su gyur pa las lte bar bsam mo //
translated: The navel is the transformation of the syllable āḥ.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i bde ba la yang dag par longs spyod pa'i mchod pa'i don du rang dang 'dra ba dang lhan cig dga' ba tsam par byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i bde ba la yang dag par longs spyod pa'i mchod pa'i don du rang dang 'dra ba dang lhan cig dga' ba tsam par byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the purpose of worship of the enjoyment of the unsurpassed bliss of all the Tathagatas, one should bless oneself as being in union with one's own counterpart.

original: aom sarbba ta th'a ga t'a nu r'a ga na badzra sv'a bh'a wa a'atma ko&amp ;
analyzed: aom sarbba ta th'a ga t'a nu r'a ga na badzra sv'a bh'a wa a'atma ko&amp ;
translated: Om, I am the vajra nature of the passion of all the Tathagatas.

original: ham ; 'di dag ni dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ham ; 'di dag ni dang po'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi called first union.

original: de'i 'og tu rab tu dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa lnga khar bcug la 'dod chags chen po'i mes zhu bar gyur nas rdo rje'i lam nas phyung la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rab tu dga' ba'i sgras de bzhin gshegs pa lnga khar bcug la 'dod chags chen po'i mes zhu bar gyur nas rdo rje'i lam nas phyung la /
translated: Then, with the sound of great joy, one should insert the five Tathagatas into one's mouth, and having melted them with the fire of great passion, one should draw them out through the vajra path.

original: rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma'i chu skyes kyi nang du byang chub kyi sems zhu ba'i dkyil 'khor yi ge hr'i:dmar pos byin gyis brlab par bsams la /
analyzed: rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma'i chu skyes kyi nang du byang chub kyi sems zhu ba'i dkyil 'khor yi ge hr'i:dmar pos byin gyis brlab par bsams la /
translated: One should imagine that the mandala of the melted bodhicitta is in the lotus of one's own counterpart, and is blessed by the syllable hriḥ.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i bdag por gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mngon par sprul la /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i bdag por gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo mngon par sprul la /
translated: That completely transforms into the manifest emanation of the mandala circle of Bhagavat Amitābha as the lord.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir phyi rol du spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir phyi rol du spro bar bya ste /
translated: In order to perfect one’s own and others’ goals, emanate externally.

original: a'a ro lik ces pas 'od dpag tu med pa sku mdog dmar po dang / zhal dmar po dang / sngon po dang / dkar po zhal gsum dang ldan pa /

analyzed: phyag drug pa rtsa ba'i phyag gnyis kyis rang dang 'dra ba la 'khyud pa /

original: gsum pa na ral gri bsnams pa /
analyzed: gsum pa na ral gri bsnams pa /

original: g-yon gyi phyag gnyis pa na rin po che /
analyzed: g-yon gyi phyag gnyis pa na rin po che /

analyzed: gsum pa na 'khor lo bsnams pa phyung la sgros pas 'gro ba rnams gsung gi rdo rje'i rnam par byas nas /

analyzed: de'i skur bcug la de yang rang gi lus la dngos po thams cad kyis gzhug par bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du yang spro ba dang bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should emanate and gather in all directions.

analyzed: de nas dzin dzik ces bya bas rnam par snang mdzad snga ma lta bu phyung la shar phyogs kyi zla ba la dgod par bya'o //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu ratna dhrik ces bya bas rin chen 'byung ldan sku mdog ser po /

original: gsum pa na padma bsnams pa /

translated: and in the third a lotus.

analyzed: de nas badzra dhrik ces bya bas mi bskyod pa sku mdog sngon po /
translated: Then, through vajra-dhṛk, one should place Akṣobhya, who is blue,

analyzed: m'a ma k'i dang sgra rdo rje dang chos kyi dbyings rdo rje dang shes rab mthar byed dang bgegs mthar byed kyi dbu la ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: On the heads of Mamaki, Shabdavajra, Dharmadhatavajra, Prajna-jayanta, and Vighnantakrt is Akshobhya.

original: gos dkar mo dang ro rdo rje dang rta mgrin gyi dbu la ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: gos dkar mo dang ro rdo rje dang rta mgrin gyi dbu la ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o //

original: sgrol ma dang reg rdo rje'i dbu la ni don yod grub pa'o //

analyzed: dri rdo rje'i dbu la ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: In the head of Gandhavajra is Ratnasaibhava.

original: sa'i snying po dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang / kun du bzang po'i dbul ni go rims bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad dang /
analyzed: sa'i snying po dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang / kun du bzang po'i dbul ni go rims bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad dang /
translated: In the heads of Ksitigarbha, Vajrapani, Akasagarbha, Lokesvara, Sarvanivarana Viskambini, and Samantabhadra, one should visualize, respectively, Vairocana,

analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med ba dang / don yong grub ba dang / mi bskyod pa bsam par bya'o //

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i gtso bo la sogs pa dkyil 'khor pa 'di dag thams cad rigs kyi bdag po dang bcas shing shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin dri ma med pa'i mchog tu bde ba dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du bsam par bya'o //

translated: One should think that all of these deities of the mandala, including the principal one of the mandala, are endowed with the lord of the family, and are of the nature of the highest bliss, which is stainless and the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni sgrub pa chen po dang dbang gi 'bras bu chen po yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni sgrub pa chen po dang dbang gi 'bras bu chen po yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the great accomplishment and the great result of consecration.

original: de nas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nam mkha'i khams na gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul thams cad bdag nyid kyi rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma'i snying gar cho ga bzhin @229b du bcug la rang dang 'dra ba'i
analyzed: de nas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nam mkha'i khams na gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul thams cad bdag nyid kyi rang dang 'dra ba'i rig ma'i snying gar cho ga bzhin @229b du bcug la rang dang 'dra ba'i
translated: Then, by the mass of light rays from the seed syllable in the heart of the gnosis being, all objects such as form that exist in the realm of space are placed in the heart of the knowledge consort who is similar to oneself, according to the rite.

original: padma'i nang du zhu bar gyur pa bsams nas /
analyzed: padma'i nang du zhu bar gyur pa bsams nas /
translated: One should think that they melt into the lotus of one who is similar to oneself.

original: de'i 'od zer las byung ba'i gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs rnams dang / phyi'i mchod pa'i chogs rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par mchod la /

translated: With the hosts of goddesses such as Rūpavajrā, who arise from the light rays, and with the outer hosts of offerings, one should make offerings to the maṇḍala wheel.

original: mchod pa dang mchod pa byed pa po dbyer med du nga rgyal byas nas /
analyzed: mchod pa dang mchod pa byed pa po dbyer med du nga rgyal byas nas /
translated: Having made the pride of indivisibility with the offering and the offerer,🔽one should recite:

analyzed: aom sarbba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sv'a bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: oṃ all tathāgatas’ vajra offering, I am of the nature.

original: de nas bdag nyid dkyil 'khor pa dang bcas pa la 'di ltar bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid dkyil 'khor pa dang bcas pa la 'di ltar bstod par bya'o //
translated: Then one should praise oneself and the maṇḍala wheel in the following way:

original: rdo rje mi 'chi rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje mi 'chi rgyal po che //
translated: The vajra is the great king of immortality,

original: mi rtog nam mkhar rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: mi rtog nam mkhar rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: the nonconceptual space-vajra holder,

original: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa brnyes //
analyzed: 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa brnyes //
translated: who has attained the perfection of desire,

original: rdo rje gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje gsung la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: homage to Vajra Speech.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dag pa che //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dag pa che //
translated: Vairocana is the great purity,

original: rdo rje zhi ba dga' chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje zhi ba dga' chen po //
translated: the vajra peace, the great joy,

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal mchog gi mchog / ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal mchog gi mchog / ston pa rdo rje phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: the supreme of supreme clear lights by nature—homage to the teacher Vajra.

original: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
analyzed: rin chen rgyal po rab tu zab //
translated: The jewel king is very profound,

original: rdo rje nam mkha' dri ma med //
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' dri ma med //
translated: Vajra, sky, stainless,

original: rang bzhin dag pa gos pa med //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pa gos pa med //
translated: Pure by nature, unstained,

original: rdo rje sku la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje sku la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the vajra body.

original: mi bskyod rdo rje ye shes che //
analyzed: mi bskyod rdo rje ye shes che //
translated: Akshobhya, great wisdom,

original: rdo rje dbyings ni mkhas chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings ni mkhas chen po //
translated: Vajra realm, great expert,

original: dkyil 'khor mchog gsum yi ge gsum //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mchog gsum yi ge gsum //
translated: Three mandalas, three syllables,

original: rdo rje dbyings la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the vajra realm.

original: don yod rgyal po rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: don yod rgyal po rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: Amoghasiddhi, perfect buddha,

original: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad rdzogs mdzad pa //
translated: Accomplisher of all wishes,

original: rang bzhin dag pa las byung ba //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pa las byung ba //
translated: Arisen from pure nature,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Vajrasattva.

original: de nas bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho ga 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho ga 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: Then one should perform the rite of tasting the elixir as follows:

analyzed: mdun du yi ge yam yongs su gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu'i dbyibs can ba dan gyis mtshan pa bsams la /
translated: In front of oneself, from the transformation of the syllable yam, one should imagine a wind mandala in the shape of a bow marked with a flag.

original: de'i steng du ram yongs su gyur pa las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum rab tu 'bar ba'i gzugs can dmigs la /
analyzed: de'i steng du ram yongs su gyur pa las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum rab tu 'bar ba'i gzugs can dmigs la /
translated: Upon that, from the transformation of ram, one should visualize a triangular fire mandala with the form of blazing flames.

original: de'i steng du aa yongs su gyur pa las thod pa de'i nang du bdud rtsi lnga bhr'um a'am dzr'im kham h'um /
analyzed: de'i steng du aa yongs su gyur pa las thod pa de'i nang du bdud rtsi lnga bhr'um a'am dzr'im kham h'um /
translated: Upon that, the five elixirs arise from the complete transformation of the āḥ syllable.🔽

original: zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs par bsams nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs par bsams nas /
translated: On top of that, the transformation of aṃ is a skull cup, inside of which are the five nectars, blessed by the seed syllables of the five tathāgatas, bhrūṃ aṃ jriṃ khaṃ hūṃ.

original: de'i 'og tu bsreg pa dang 'bar ba la sogs pas yang dag par sbyangs la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsreg pa dang 'bar ba la sogs pas yang dag par sbyangs la /
translated: After that, it is purified by burning, blazing, and so on.

original: aom gyis byin gyis brlabs par bsams nas /
analyzed: aom gyis byin gyis brlabs par bsams nas /
translated: Then, it is blessed by oṃ.

original: de'i steng du h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje bsam mo //
translated: Above that, one should imagine a vajra arisen from hūṃ.

original: de nas yi ge aom gyi 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi bdud rtsi bkug la /
analyzed: de nas yi ge aom gyi 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi bdud rtsi bkug la /
translated: Then, the nectar of the gnosis of all tathāgatas is summoned by the light rays of the syllable oṃ.

original: bdud rtsi lnga po de nyid kyi nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga po de nyid kyi nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: That nectar is caused to enter the five nectars.

original: de nas bsreg ba dang 'bar bas yi ge aom dang rdo rje de nyid du zhu bar gyur par bsams la /
analyzed: de nas bsreg ba dang 'bar bas yi ge aom dang rdo rje de nyid du zhu bar gyur par bsams la /
translated: Then, it is burned and blazed by the syllable oṃ and the vajra, which melt into light.

original: de ltar bskyed @230a * //
analyzed: de ltar bskyed @230a * //
translated: One should imagine that.

original: pa'i bdud rtsi de lca la yi ge h'um las rdo rje bkod pa'i lce bzang po dang / ro rdo rjes bstabs pas bdag nyid dang / dkyil 'khor ba rnams tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i bdud rtsi de lca la yi ge h'um las rdo rje bkod pa'i lce bzang po dang / ro rdo rjes bstabs pas bdag nyid dang / dkyil 'khor ba rnams tshim par bya'o //
translated: The nectar is placed on the tongue, which is imagined as a good tongue, a vajra marked with the syllable hūṃ, and is offered to oneself and the maṇḍala circle by the taste-vajra.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor 'byin pa nas bdud rtsi myong ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor 'byin pa nas bdud rtsi myong ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Thus, from the emanation of the maṇḍala up to the tasting of the nectar,

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: this is the samādhi called the supreme king of maṇḍalas.

original: sems dbang du gyur pa thob na zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dbang du gyur pa thob na zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one attains mastery of the mind, one accomplishes the welfare of beings through pacifying and other activities.

original: thig le rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba yin pas sems brtan par bya ba'i don du las kyi rgyal po mchog bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thig le rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba yin pas sems brtan par bya ba'i don du las kyi rgyal po mchog bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In order to stabilize the mind, one should meditate on the supreme king of actions, which is the meditation on the bindu yoga.

original: de bas na ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis khams gsum po snang bar byas nas rang gi lha'i rnam par byas la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams kyis khams gsum po snang bar byas nas rang gi lha'i rnam par byas la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lor gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, having illuminated the three realms with the light rays from the seed syllable in the heart of the gnosis being, one should transform them into one's deity form and induct them into the maṇḍala circle.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni bdag nyid la gzhug go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni bdag nyid la gzhug go //
translated: The maṇḍala wheel is placed in oneself.

original: bdag ni ye shes sems dpa' la gzhug go //
analyzed: bdag ni ye shes sems dpa' la gzhug go //
translated: One is placed in the gnosis being.

original: ye shes sems dpa' ni mtshan mar ro //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' ni mtshan mar ro //
translated: The gnosis being is placed in the sign.

original: mtshan ma ni tsa na ka'i tshad kyi thig ler bcug la /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni tsa na ka'i tshad kyi thig ler bcug la /
translated: The sign is placed in the bindu the size of a chickpea.

original: thig le'i dbus su bskyed pa'i rim pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo skad cig tsam gyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thig le'i dbus su bskyed pa'i rim pas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo skad cig tsam gyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the center of the bindu, one should meditate on the maṇḍala wheel in an instant through the stage of generation.

original: 'dir bsnyen pa la sogs pa ni chen po'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir bsnyen pa la sogs pa ni chen po'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: Here, the great sound is expressed in the recitation, and so on.

original: tsa na ka'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam du de ltar bsgoms la /
analyzed: tsa na ka'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam du de ltar bsgoms la /
translated: Having meditated on that in the size of a chickpea,

original: yang thig le'i dbus su chud pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs su snang ba las sa bon du bsam mo //
analyzed: yang thig le'i dbus su chud pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs su snang ba las sa bon du bsam mo //
translated: one should imagine the seed in the appearance of a mass of light rays in the center of the bindu.

original: sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams las mtshan ma'i mtshan ma'i 'od zer rnams las ye shes sems dpar bsam mo //
analyzed: sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams las mtshan ma'i mtshan ma'i 'od zer rnams las ye shes sems dpar bsam mo //
translated: From the light rays of the seed, one should imagine the sign. From the light rays of the sign, one should imagine the gnosis being.

original: ye shes sems dpa'i 'od zer spros pa las /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa'i 'od zer spros pa las /
translated: From the light rays of the gnosis being,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i bdag nyid bsam mo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i bdag nyid bsam mo //
translated: one should imagine the maṇḍala lord.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i 'od zer gyi snang ba las /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i 'od zer gyi snang ba las /
translated: Then, from the appearance of the light rays of the principal deity of the mandala,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo snga ma bzhin du gnas par bsams la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo snga ma bzhin du gnas par bsams la /
translated: the mandala circle is imagined to abide as before.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo de kun du spros pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis khams gsum pa ma lus par de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs kyis khyab par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo de kun du spros pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis khams gsum pa ma lus par de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs kyis khyab par bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated that the entire trichiliocosm is pervaded by the hosts of tathāgatas through the light rays that emanate from the entire mandala circle,

original: yang de bzhin du thig le'i bar du bsdu zhing slar spro ba dang / slar yang thig le'i bar du bsdu ba dang / de bzhin du dkyil 'khor lo bsgom pa ji srid 'dod kyi bar du byas pa ni thig le'i rnal 'byor @230b ro ;
analyzed: yang de bzhin du thig le'i bar du bsdu zhing slar spro ba dang / slar yang thig le'i bar du bsdu ba dang / de bzhin du dkyil 'khor lo bsgom pa ji srid 'dod kyi bar du byas pa ni thig le'i rnal 'byor @230b ro ;
translated: again, one should gather the light rays into the bindu as before, emanate them again, gather them into the bindu again, and meditate on the mandala circle as much as one wishes.

original: / de'i 'og tu nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshin gshegs pa rnams bdag nyid kyi khar bcug ste /
analyzed: / de'i 'og tu nam mkha' la bzhugs pa'i rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshin gshegs pa rnams bdag nyid kyi khar bcug ste /
translated: After that, the tathāgatas of the five families abiding in the sky are placed in one’s mouth.

original: byang chub kyi sems zhu bar gyur ba las rdo rje'i lam nas phyung ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhu bar gyur ba las rdo rje'i lam nas phyung ste /
translated: They melt into bodhicitta, which is drawn out through the vajra path.

original: snga ma bzhin du rang dang 'dra ba'i padma'i lte bar byang chub kyi sems zhu ba'i thig ler bsams la der yi ge hr'i:yongs su gyur pa las padma tsa na ka'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam du bsgoms la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rang dang 'dra ba'i padma'i lte bar byang chub kyi sems zhu ba'i thig ler bsams la der yi ge hr'i:yongs su gyur pa las padma tsa na ka'i 'bras bu'i tshad tsam du bsgoms la /
translated: As before, one should imagine in the center of a lotus like oneself a drop of melted bodhicitta, and in that a letter hrīḥ, which is transformed into a lotus the size of a jujube fruit.

original: padma'i lte ba'i dbus su dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bskyed pa'i rim pas skad cig gis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i lte ba'i dbus su dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bskyed pa'i rim pas skad cig gis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the center of the lotus one should meditate on the circle of the maṇḍala by the process of creation in an instant.

original: 'dir bsnyen pa la sogs pa ni chen po'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir bsnyen pa la sogs pa ni chen po'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: Here, the repetition and so forth are expressed by the word “great.”

original: 'di la ji srid du sems brtan par ma gyur pa de srid du shin tu spro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la ji srid du sems brtan par ma gyur pa de srid du shin tu spro bar mi bya'o //
translated: Here, as long as the mind does not become stable, one should not be very enthusiastic.

original: sems brtan par gyur nas ni yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang spro ba dang bsdu bar bya ba ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: sems brtan par gyur nas ni yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang spro ba dang bsdu bar bya ba ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: When the mind becomes stable, then the emanation and gathering of the tathāgatas is the yoga of subtlety.

original: de nas bsgoms pas skyo na /
analyzed: de nas bsgoms pas skyo na /
translated: Then, when one becomes weary through meditation,

original: yi ge dgu po ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon yongs su bskor te gnas pa la bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge dgu po ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i sa bon yongs su bskor te gnas pa la bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: one should perform repetition, encircling the seed syllable in the heart of the gnosis being with the nine-syllable [mantra].

original: aom a'a:aom ma ni padme h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a:aom ma ni padme h'um h'um /
translated: Reciting the mantra Om Ah Om Manipadme Hum Hum,

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags zlos shing sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje re re zhing ngam thugs rdo rje'i bdag nyid can dang ye shes sems dpa' dang de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje dang / ye shes sems dpa' dang lhan cig lnga po'i bdag nyid can bsams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags zlos shing sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje re re zhing ngam thugs rdo rje'i bdag nyid can dang ye shes sems dpa' dang de'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje dang / ye shes sems dpa' dang lhan cig lnga po'i bdag nyid can bsams la /
translated: one should contemplate the nature of the vajra body, speech, and mind, the wisdom being, and the vajra body, speech, and mind of that [wisdom being], and the five natures together with the wisdom being.

original: de re re zhing 'byin pa dang 'jug pa'i rlung gis rim gyis sam cig car spro ba dang bsdu bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de re re zhing 'byin pa dang 'jug pa'i rlung gis rim gyis sam cig car spro ba dang bsdu bar bya zhing /
translated: One should radiate and gather them gradually or instantaneously with the exhaling and inhaling winds of each of those [natures].
